passages.title: A Brief History of Artificial Intelligence
passages.text: Research in artificial intelligence began in the mid-20th century, evolving from symbolic methods to modern deep learning approaches. The 1956 Dartmouth Conference is considered a turning point. In recent years, the growth of data and computing power has driven major advances in natural language processing and computer vision.

passages.title: Impacts of Urbanisation
passages.text: Rapid urbanisation increases economic opportunities while putting pressure on infrastructure. Traffic congestion, air pollution, and housing costs are common issues in large cities. Sustainable urban planning plays a critical role in mitigating these challenges.
